column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=The criminal justice system is a rehabilitative system ?
#Text=That ’s not what I think it is now .
#Text=Is that what it should be ?
#Text=I think the purpose of the criminal justice system should be —
#Text=yeah , that would be great , if it could be done .
#Text=But its primary purpose is to promote safety , to reduce crime .
#Text=How does it do that ?
#Text=Believe me , I ’m not an apologist for the criminal justice system .

#Text=I think it ’s in a terrible state , in part because quite a few years ago the official policy , at least at the federal level , and the states certainly seem to be in the avant-garde on this , was to not be focused on rehabilitation but to be focused on retribution .
#Text=The federal sentencing guidelines , I believe , explicitly endorse a retributive purpose for the criminal justice system .
#Text=I disagree with that .
#Text=Decriminalization of drugs and suicide
#Text=Are you an active member of NORML ?
#Text=I do n’t know .
#Text=I certainly support their goals and I have spoken at their conventions .
#Text=Do you believe in the decriminalization of marijuana ?
#Text=Absolutely , and everything .
#Text=For adults .
#Text=Can you give me your case for that ?
#Text=Sure , it ’s official ACLU policy , which I wholeheartedly endorse .

#Text=I think it was well summarized by one of our board members years ago when the crack cocaine epidemic was starting , and somebody said we should re-examine our policy which opposed the criminalization of substances for adults .
#Text=Maybe we should re-examine it in light of this new dangerous drug .
#Text=And we did re-examine and unanimously re-affirmed .

#Text=In the course of that debate , one Board member said , “ We believe that every consenting adult should have the right to imbibe , ingest , inhale or insert whatever he or she wants into his or her own body .
#Text=It ’s a matter of individual freedom of choice . ”
#Text=Does that mean they should do it ?
#Text=Not necessarily , not any more than somebody should smoke or drink or eat McDonald ’s hamburgers .
#Text=Should suicide be legal ?
#Text=Absolutely .

#Text=The idea of government making determinations about how you end your life , forcing you , which could be considered cruel and unusual punishment in certain circumstances , and Justice Stevens in a very interesting opinion in a right-to-die raised the analogy .
#Text=But you said before you turned on the tape that you typically ask people how they would want to die , which is very interesting .
#Text=I mean , of the zillions of questions I have been asked , nobody has ever asked me that !
#Text=It ’s very rare I am asked a question that I have never been asked before .
#Text=So how would you like to die ?
#Text=Well , the first thing that occurred to me was : I want to have the choice .

#Text=That was the very first thing that occurred to me , because I know how through personal experiences , through vicarious experiences , through reading the complaints in our law suits where we have challenged the absolute restrictions on compassion and dying , people are essentially tortured .
#Text=And I do n’t want that to happen .
#Text=And I do n’t want my loved ones tortured by watching that happen .
